Trent_Harmon:
{{short description|American country music singer (born 1990)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Trent Harmon | image = Trent Harmon (cropped).jpg | caption = Harmon in 2022 | birth_name = Trenton William Harmon | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|10|08}}{{cite web | url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/trent-harmon-mn0003497516 | title=Trent Harmon biography | work=AllMusic | access-date=6 September 2019}} | birth_place = [[Amory, Mississippi]], United States | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[Pop music|pop]]|[[Soul music|soul]]}} | occupation = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}} | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|piano|guitar|drums}} | years_active = 2016â€“present | label = {{hlist|[[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]]|[[19 Recordings|19]]|}} | website = {{URL|www.TrentHarmon.com}} }} '''Trenton William Harmon''' (born October 8, 1990) is an American [[country music]] singer who gained national attention for winning the [[American Idol (season 15)|fifteenth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]'' on April 7, 2016. ==Early life and education== Harmon was born in [[Amory, Mississippi]], the son of Cindy and Randy Harmon and second cousin of actor Richard Harmon.[http://monroecountyjournal.com/2015/03/11/harmon-has-the-voice-to-make-it-to-shows-l-a-auditions/ Harmon has "The Voice" to make it to show's L.A. auditions]. Monroe County Journal (March 11, 2015). Retrieved on 2016-04-26. He started in music when his mother taught him to sing "[[Amazing Grace]]" when he was the age of five, and he grew up singing in church.{{cite web |last1=Bronson|first1=Fred |title= 'American Idol' Top 24: Meet the First 12 Finalists|url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/idol-worship/6874866/american-idol-top-24-first-12-finalists|publisher=Mission Viejo|access-date=February 11, 2016}}{{cite web|last1=Ortiz|first1=Alice|title=Harmon has "The Voice" to make it to show's L.A. auditions|url=http://monroecountyjournal.com/2015/03/11/harmon-has-the-voice-to-make-it-to-shows-l-a-auditions/|publisher=Monroe Journal|access-date=March 11, 2015}} His family owns a farm and a yard-to-table restaurant, Longhorn, where he was a waiter.{{cite news|last1=Altman|first1=Isabelle|title=Amory native heading to Hollywood|url=http://www.cdispatch.com/news/article.asp?aid=47520|newspaper=The Dispatch|access-date=February 11, 2016}}{{cite magazine|last1=Molinari|first1=Jessica|title=Country Trent Harmon Impressed The 'American Idol' Judges With His Smooth R&B Sound|url=http://www.bustle.com/articles/134280-country-trent-harmon-impressed-the-american-idol-judges-with-his-smooth-rb-sound|magazine=Bustle|access-date=April 14, 2016}} He credits his upbringing on the farm and in the restaurant for his strong work ethic. He sang and performed through many musicals while attending Amory High School and, later, the [[University of Arkansas at Monticello]] where he also led on-campus worship services as an undergraduate. He first learned to play the piano but expanded to also play drums and guitar. ==Music career== Harmon first tried for national recognition in May 2014 when a close friend convinced him to try out for NBC's ''[[The Voice (U.S. TV series)|The Voice]]'' in New Orleans. After singing "[[Stay with Me (Sam Smith song)|Stay with Me]]" by [[Sam Smith]] for the casting director he was one of 300 open audition contestants chosen to compete further from a field of 32,000. The show then flew him to compete in Los Angeles where he sang "Jealous" by Nick Jonas. Months later in October 2014 he was again flown to Los Angeles for several weeks with his family to be filmed for the show although ultimately no judge chose him and his audition did not air.{{cite web|last1=Parker|first1=Lyndsey|title='American Idol' Winner Trent Harmon Talks 'Voice' Past, Musical Future|date=April 9, 2016 |url=https://www.yahoo.com/music/american-idol-winner-trent-harmon-talks-voice-014754792.html|publisher=Yahoo Music|access-date=April 14, 2016}} Harmon later stated that the rejection prepared him for his 'Idol' phase of his career. ===''American Idol''=== Harmon auditioned for ''American Idol'' in [[Little Rock, Arkansas]], in August 2015,{{cite news |url= http://www.arkansasmatters.com/news/local-news/another-round-of-american-idol-auditions-in-little-rock |title=Another Round of American Idol Auditions in Little Rock|date=August 24, 2015 |work=Arkansas Matters}} surprising the judges, after hearing of his farm upbringing, singing the rhythm and blues song "[[Allen Stone (album)|Unaware]]" by [[Allen Stone]]. He was the first RnB singer shown to be accepted by the judges in the season. It was revealed later in the season that Harmon kept a leather-bound journal where he wrote down every comment and criticism the judges offered.{{cite news|last1=Reiter|first1=Amy|title='American Idol' finale: And the final 'Idol' winner is ...|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/showtracker/la-et-st-american-idol-finale-recap-winner-20160407-story.html|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|access-date=April 14, 2016}} During Hollywood week he was encouraged to quit when diagnosed with [[Infectious mononucleosis|mono]], and sequestered in a bathroom for most of the week to keep the contagious disease from spreading.{{cite magazine|last1=Angermiller|first1=Michelle Amabile|title='American Idol' Winner Trent Harmon on His Big Moment & What's Next|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7326360/american-idol-winner-trent-harmon-talks-big-win|magazine=Billboard|access-date=April 13, 2016}} Harmon impressed the judges when, for an 'Idol' first he performed the group round as a solo.{{cite magazine|last1=Molinari|first1=Jessica|title=Trent Harmon Sings Sia's 'Chandelier' In The 'American Idol' Top 5, Proves He Can Sing Anything|url=http://www.bustle.com/articles/150090-trent-harmon-sings-sias-chandelier-in-the-american-idol-top-5-proves-he-can-sing-anything|magazine=Bustle|access-date=April 14, 2016}} During "Idol Grammy Hits" week Harmon was coached to bring his "strange faces he makes when he sings" under control.{{cite news|last1=Reiter|first1=Amy|title='American Idol' recap: The Top 10 whittled down to the Top 8|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/showtracker/la-et-st-american-idol-recap-20160304-story.html|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|access-date=April 14, 2016}} Judge Harry Connick Jr. noted Harmon also lost an "exaggerated jaw vibrato" that would eventually cause him to lose his singing voice. Harmon won the fifteenth season of ''American Idol'' on April 7, 2016. His winning coronation single "[[Falling (Trent Harmon song)|Falling]]" was written by singer songwriter and ''American Idol'' judge [[Keith Urban]] with [[Dallas Davidson]] and [[Brett James]].{{cite magazine|last1=Angermiller|first1=Michele Amabile|title='American Idol': Keith Urban Talks Trent Harmon's 'Amazing' Coronation Song|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7325499/keith-urban-trent-harmon-american-idol-coronation|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=April 7, 2016|access-date=April 8, 2016}} For winning the title, Harmon received a [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]] car and a recording contract with [[Big Machine Records]]. [[La'Porsha Renae]] was named runner-up. Harmon parted ways with Big Machine in May 2019. ====Performances==== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- ! scope="col" | Week ! scope="col" | Theme ! scope="col" | Song(s) ! scope="col" | Original artist(s) ! scope="col" | Result |- | Auditions | Contestant's choice | "[[Allen Stone (album)|Unaware]]" | [[Allen Stone]] |Advanced |- | rowspan="3"|Hollywood Week |Lines of 10 |"[[Lay Me Down (Sam Smith song)|Lay Me Down]]"{{cite magazine|last1=Molinari|first1=Jessica|title='American Idol' Contestant Trent Harmon Advances To The Next Round In Hollywood, Despite His Mono|url=http://www.bustle.com/articles/138205-american-idol-contestant-trent-harmon-advances-to-the-next-round-in-hollywood-despite-his-mono|magazine=Bustle|access-date=April 14, 2016}} |[[Sam Smith (singer)|Sam Smith]] |rowspan="3"|Advanced |- |Group Rounds* |"[[Rather Be (Clean Bandit song)|Rather Be]]"{{cite journal|last1=Meynes|first1=Carolyn|title='American Idol' Season 15 Recap/Review: Group Rounds Bring Out the Claws|url=http://www.musictimes.com/articles/63650/20160129/american-idol-season-15-recap-review-group-round.htm|journal=Music Times|date=January 29, 2016|access-date=April 14, 2016}} |[[Clean Bandit]] ft. [[Sia]] |- |rowspan="2"|Finale | Finale show | "[[It Takes Two (Marvin Gaye and Kim Weston song)|It Takes Two]]"
{{small|(duet with La'Porsha Renae)}}{{cite magazine|last1=Upadhyaya|first1=Kayla Kumari|title='American Idol' Recap: A Winner is Crowned During Nostalgic Sendoff|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/idol-worship/7326345/american-idol-recap-winner-crowned-nostalgia|magazine=Billboard|access-date=April 13, 2016}} | [[Marvin Gaye]] and [[Kim Weston]] |- | Winner's song | "Falling" | Trent Harmon |} ===Post-''Idol''=== Following his win on ''American Idol'' Harmon was signed by [[Big Machine Records]]. His album has country and [[indie-soul]] influences.{{cite web|title='American Idol' Winner Trent Harmon Talks 'Voice' Past, Musical Future|last1=Parker|first1=Lindsey|url=https://www.yahoo.com/music/american-idol-winner-trent-harmon-talks-voice-014754792.html|publisher=Yahoo|date=April 8, 2016|access-date=April 9, 2016}} Big Machine's Scott Borcheta said it would be like the country album [[Justin Timberlake]] would make. In a post-show interview Harmon was asked his thoughts on home state's anti-LGBT "Religious Liberty" legislation (HB1523) which allows people and businesses to deny service to LGBT people.{{cite magazine|last1=Kaufman|first1=Gil|title='American Idol' Winner Trent Harmon on Mississippi's Anti-LGBT Bill: 'Love All People. Period.'|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7332951/american-idol-trent-harmon-anyone-can-eat-at-his-family-mississippi-restaurant-renae|magazine=Billboard|access-date=April 13, 2016}} Harmon recounted that in the restaurant business, he served whoever walked in the door and treated them with respect, and "I think that you should treat all people equally and respectfully, and that's what I do, and that's what I'm going to continue to do no matter what law is passed."{{cite news|last1=Barnes|first1=Dustin|title='American Idol': Trent Harmon talks Miss. law|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/nation-now/2016/04/13/american-idol-trent-harmon-talks-miss-law/83007840/|newspaper=USA Today|access-date=April 14, 2016}} In December 2016, he released his self-titled EP which features his Top 30 hit "There's a Girl" and four other tracks.{{Cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/trent-harmon-ep/id1182000261|title = Trent Harmon - EP by Trent Harmon| website=[[iTunes]] |date = December 9, 2016}} Throughout 2017, Harmon experienced some difficulties, from a personal break-up, to his record label folding and its parent company restructuring, leaving his contract in limbo. By the end of the year, his label issues were resolved and he re-signed with Big Machine Label Group.{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8221424/trent-harmon-you-got-em-all|title = Trent Harmon Longs for Better Days with Powerful 'You Got 'Em All'| magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] }} In February 2018, he premiered the single "You Got 'Em All",{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/trent-harmon-the-final-winner-of-american-idol-finally-releases-new-music-1202690231/ |title=Trent Harmon, the 'Final' Winner of 'American Idol,' Finally Releases New Music|author= Michele Amabile Angermiller|work=Variety |date=February 7, 2018 }} which also serves as the title track for his debut album, released on May 18, 2018.{{cite web |url=https://people.com/country/trent-harmon-album-release-youve-got-em-all/ |title=Trent Harmon Sings His Heartbreak, But His Relationship Isn't Over: 'It's Uncharted Territory' | author=Nancy Kruh |date = May 18, 2018 |work=People}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:8em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:17em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:9em;"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:4em;"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
